intro: Camelina myagrodes, commonly known as yellow cameline, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important oilseed crops. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and small, elongated pods that contain seeds. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in dry, open habitats. The seeds of Camelina myagrodes are rich in oil and have been used for both culinary and industrial purposes.
